oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Nashville Cats program - Norbert Putnam - 2009-11-14
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview program on the life and career of Norbert Putnam to date from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on November 14, 2009
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Norbert Putnam;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Includes questions from the audience. Includes audio from video and selected audio excerpts. Program begins in progress. Hosted by Bill Lloyd. Subjects include: family history -- why he played bass -- musical inspirations -- meeting up with drummer Jerry Carrigan and attending the University of North Alabama -- making his first recordings with Rick Hall and Arthur Alexander -- Muscle Shoals rhythm section memories -- Bill Lowery -- Tommy Roe and the Beatles -- Rick Hall -- Playing with the Beatles for their first American concert performance -- Moving to Nashville -- First hits recording in Nashville -- playing country club dates and getting advice from Owen Bradley -- Working with Owen Bradley in recording sessions -- Working with Henry Mancini -- Elvis Presley and Felton Jarvis story -- Michael Nesmith recording sessions and the formation of the band Area Code 615 -- Story of Area Code 615 appearance on the Johnny Cash Show --

The beginnings of Quadraphonic Studios and Elliot Mazor -- Meeting Troy Seals -- Recording Long Long Time with Linda Ronstadt -- Meeting Kris Kristofferson -- Producing Joan Baez and Clive Davis wanting him to produce Columbia records folk artists -- Working with Dan Fogelberg -- Working with Charlie Rich -- Working with Jimmy Buffett and producing the song Margaritaville -- Fogelberg coming back to Nashville after working in California with Joe Walsh -- Later production work -- Moving to Granada Mississippi -- Working at Delta State University -- Moving to Jackson Tennessee -- Closing comments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Putnam, Norbert; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
